tile.name: emberbound_scout
tile.description: A lithe, scar‑marked scout in heat‑resistant leather and rune‑etched plates, wielding a faintly glowing ember blade.

player.back_history: Archetype: Emberbound Scout – a former dwarven forge apprentice cast out for sabotaging the Heat‑Engines. Driven by revenge against the goblin‑flame warlords and a desperate need to reclaim the lost Heartforge for his people, he descends into Emberforge seeking both redemption and the power to end the Scalding Curse. Visuals: gaunt, soot‑blackened skin, a scarred iron‑ringed helm cracked at the crown, a heat‑resistant leather coat patched with rune‑etched metal plates, and a curved ember‑etched blade that glows faintly with molten light. He bears a scar across his left eye from a molten splash, and his boots are reinforced with copper‑capped greaves that clink with each step.

tile.name: emberheart_core
tile.description: A smooth, obsidian sphere the size of a clenched fist, veins of molten amber pulse within its core, casting a fierce inner glow. Ancient dwarven runes spiral across its surface, each glowing faintly with trapped fire, while a thin rim of hammered silver forms a perfect, unbreakable band. The sphere hums with raw elemental energy, radiating heat that can melt steel yet feels oddly weightless in the hand, marking it as a relic of unparalleled power.

final_objective.back_history: The Emberheart Core is the crystallized heart of the original Molten Core, ripped from the dwarves' soul‑forge during the Cataclysm and sealed deep within the Heartforge chamber. Its raw elemental fury is the source of the Scalding Curse—each pulse sends waves of magma through the lower levels, corrupting stone and spawning the Flame‑spawn. Simultaneously, goblin warlords have learned to siphon its heat, using it to power their twisted machinery and fuel their conquest. Only by extracting the Emberheart Core and carrying it to the surface can the ancient dwarven seals be reforged, halting the runaway magma and depriving the goblins of their power. Leaving it buried would doom the world to an ever‑expanding furnace, turning the entire region into a molten wasteland. The Core must be retrieved, sealed in the ancient runic vault at the citadel's entrance, and returned to the surface to end the curse and prevent the rebirth of the Heartforge's cataclysmic power.
